adverb, conjunction, &amp; preposition.description: During the period of time preceding (a particular event, date, or time)
examples: she had to rest before dinner
they lived rough for four days before they were arrested
his playing days had ended six years before
it's never happened to me before
it wasn't long before I had my first bite
trotting through the city with guards running before and behind
the patterns swam before her eyes

adverb, conjunction, &amp; preposition.description: In preference to; with a higher priority than.
examples: a skilled warrior who places duty before all else
they would die before they would cooperate with each other

origin: Old English beforan (see by, fore), of Germanic origin; related to German bevor.
